title: Skip-the-line tour of Vatican Museums, St. Peter's Basilica and Sistine Chapel
description: Book your guided tour including Vatican Museums, St. Peter's & Sistine Chapel with skip-the-line access. Less time in line, more time on art!
about:
The Vatican has so many treasures and can be overwhelming. We want you to experience it in the best way and get the most out of your visit. Skip the long lines thanks to our exclusive Vatican Partnership and learn about the fascinating collections from a professional English-speaking guide.The experience includes:
- Direct access to the Vatican Museums 
- The renowned artworks of Michelangelo and Raphael
- The famous Courtyards of the Vatican City
- The Gallery of Tapestries and the Gallery of the Candelabra
- The Sistine Chapel
- Express access to St. Peter’s Basilica*
- The stunning masterpieces including Michelangelo's 'La Pietà' 
- St. Peter’s Square where you will also see Bernini’s optical illusion
- The Pope’s balcony - where the Pope periodically delivers his blessing

For a more personalized experience, upgrade your tour chosing the option Small Group Tour (up to 12 people) when booking your tour (if available the day of your visit).*On Wednesdays, access to St Peter's Basilica and square may be closed at the time of the morning tour due to the Papal audience. On afternoon tours, your guide will tell you about St. Peter’s Basilica from St Peter’s Square before entering so that you are able to admire at your own pace.
meeting_point:
Make sure to be at the meeting point 15 min before the departure of the tour. Coordinators will be wearing blue polo shirts or jackets for easy recognition.
Tour in English: Corner of Viale Vaticano and Via Tunisi, between Caffè Vaticano and Hotel Alimandi Vaticano. Meet us down the wide steps across the street from the entrance of the Vatican Museums. Metro stop: Ottaviano-Musei Vaticani (line A).Tour in French, German, Spanish, Portuguese or Italian: Corner of Piazza Santa Maria delle Grazie and Via Candia, at the very bottom of the steps that join Via Candia to Viale Vaticano. Metro stop: Cipro (line A).

title: Vatican Museums, St. Peter’s and Sistine Chapel: Tickets and Skip the line Private Tour
description: Get all the best information for Private Vatican Museums, St. Peter's Basilica & Sistine Chapel Tour with Skip the Line. Book your tickets, skipping the line, at official rates. Get informed, plan your trip and book your tour of Rome.
about: With this Skip the Line Private Vatican Tour, you will have the time and flexibility you want to experience areas of the Vatican Museums, how long you want to spend in the Sistine Chapel and St. Peter’s Basilica in a way and at a pace that suits you. Having your own personal guide means you will set the agenda for your tour. This Vatican Tour promises to be a once-in-a-lifetime experience!Sites Visited: Vatican Museums, Sistine Chapel, St. Peter's Basilica and St. Peter's Square.Vatican MuseumYour private tour starts with a Skip the Line Access at the Vatican Museum. You are able to pass the general access lines where people often wait for several hours. You will have the chance to explore places such as the Pinecone Courtyard, the Hall of Maps, the Gallery of Tapestries, the Gallery of the Candelabra and the incredible Raphael Rooms. Your guide will bring these halls and works of art to life by telling you stories about the artists behind the masterpieces and pointing out important details you could miss on your own.Sistine ChapelExperience the Sistine Chapel like no one else. You will be able to have an enriching experience with your personal guide. They will point out all the details and give richness to the experience by sharing with you history you may not know. For example, Michelangelo’s boneless self-portrait he painted was to express that he would rather be skinned alive than paint the Sistine Chapel again. As incredible as his work is, it was a backbreaking feat of willpower – a fact you will understand after learning what it takes to create a fresco.St. Peter’s Basilica With Skip the Line access you will go to St. Peter’s Basilica through a VIP entrance. Here you will see the incredible altar and marvel at Michelangelo’s beautiful sculpture, La Pietà, before heading outside for a tour of St. Peter’s Square. Your guided tour finishes here, but you have the option to see and explore more! You can admire Bernini’s clever optical illusion, spot the balcony where the Pope delivers his public addresses and take scenic photographs.
meeting_point: At the bottom of the wide steps across the street from the entrance of the Vatican Museums. The steps are located between Caffè Vaticano and Hotel Alimandi Vaticano, on the corner of Viale Vaticano and Via Tunisi. Coordinators will be wearing blue polo shirts or jackets for easy recognition. The closest metro stop is on line A (red line): Ottaviano - Musei Vaticani.

Save valuable time with the special skip-the-line ticket included

title: First entry tickets to Sistine Chapel and Vatican Museums
description: Book this combo offer including Exclusive First Entry Tickets: Sistine Chapel & Vatican Museums!
about: If you want to experience the Sistine Chapel – Michelangelo’s world-famous iconic masterpiece - before the crowds arrive, this tour is definitely for you!With our Skip the Line Access, you’ll avoid the long lines that form before the Vatican Museum doors are even open. In addition, as an Official Vatican Museums Partner, we are allowed into the Sistine Chapel 30 minutes before other tours and an hour and 30 minutes ahead of the general public.You’ll meet your small group of up to 20 people early in the morning and be accompanied to the Sistine Chapel, where you’ll have the time and the space – a full hour before the general public arrives - to contemplate its beauty. This is a far cry from the crowded afternoons when there's barely room to move around in, let alone appreciate, this incredible space.To this day, critics say that no artist’s work has ever approached the scale, technical skill, sense of composition and design of Michelangelo’s frescoes. People the world over have been awestruck by the powerful imagery of the “Creation of Adam,” painted on the Sistine Chapel ceiling, while others have marveled at “The Last Judgment,” which adorns the altar wall. You’ll have the luxury to see these 15th century masterpieces for yourself, up close and personal.After your once-in-a-lifetime Sistine Chapel experience, you have the option to visit the Vatican Museums without having to leave and enter again. Besides full-day tickets, we also provide a map of the 9-mile-long museum and an introduction to its highlights - everything you need to design your own itinerary, enjoying the world-renowned art collections at your own pace.
meeting_point: Meet us 15 min before the departure of the tour at the bottom of the wide steps across the street from the entrance of the Vatican Museums. The steps are located between Caffè Vaticano and Hotel Alimandi Vaticano, on the corner of Viale Vaticano and Via Tunisi. Our City Wonders coordinators will be wearing blue City Wonders polo shirts or jackets for easy recognition.

title: Pristine Sistine Express: Sistine Chapel and St Peter's Basilica
description: Book your Pristine Sistine Express tour on Musement now! Skip the line, early access tickets allow you to see these incredible sites before the crowds arrive.
about:
Our Sistine Chapel Express & St. Peter’s Basilica Tour is one of the best ways to experience the Vatican’s two busiest attractions without the crowds. Skip the line, early access tickets allow you to see these incredible sites before the majority of the crowds show up.This is an express tour for those who have limited time but don’t want to sacrifice the quality of their experience. By taking you through the Sistine Chapel and St. Peter’s Basilica early in the morning, you will beat the crowds and experience these incredible sites in relative peace.Your tour begins early, entering the Vatican Museums a full half hour before the common public. Before entering the Vatican Museums your guide will hand out visual aids to each guest with a legend for each of the key works of the Sistine Chapel. Using this as a reference point, your guide will brief you on some of the finer points of Michelangelo’s frescoes, and give you some tips on what to look out for. Then it’s into the Sistine Chapel to see for yourself.After 30 minutes admiring the world-famous works of Michelangelo, your group will reconvene at the bottom of the room, where you’ll use a special door to gain direct entry to St. Peter’s Basilica. Only open to tour groups, this skip the line access could save you hours of waiting in the long security lines that form outside the main entrance to the Basilica.We never run this tour with more than 20 people per group but regularly run it with fewer, so that you can always count on plenty of help and information from your expert, English-speaking guide.Sites visited:
- Sistine Chapel
- St. Peter’s Basilica

title: Vatican City: Exclusive Half-Day Guided Tour with Breakfast and Gardens
description: Book your exclusive Vatican City half-day guided tour with breakfast and gardens today! Discover amazing activities in Rome with Musement.
about: You’ll enjoy a unique experience while all is still silent and the throngs of tourists have yet to arrive. Walk through the Vatican corridors hearing only your footsteps, and savor a rich American breakfast buffet in the Vatican Cafeteria, with everything from croissants to muffins, egg to pancakes, fresh fruit to jam, and cereal to cookies. Enjoy both espresso and American coffee, or fresh juice or other cold and hot beverages. After breakfast, you’ll hop on to a shaded open-air private bus, riding through the hidden parts of Vatican State, just recently opened to the public, namely its gardens. Your guide will entertain you with historical anecdotes and intriguing facts. See the Vatican railway station, the giant Year-2000 Jubilee bell, the stunning meditation gardens in use by popes since 1279, and the Pope’s private heliport. This 45-minute journey through the Vatican State's green areas will pique your curiosity for the rest of the beauty, mystery and history within the Museum walls. Housing irreplaceable art and religious artifacts, your guide will host you on a 3-hour tour through time. Knowing your vacation time is as priceless as these masterpieces, we’ve tailored our route to the best the Museum has to offer, giving you the highlights you’ve been longing to see.Time-honored tapestries, precious relics, ancient sculptures, the galleries seem to stretch on longer than time itself. Behold the Raphael Rooms and the famous characters modeled in his 'School of Athens'. Stand before the Sistine Chapel and marvel at Michelangelo’s mastery. Learn how these fabulous frescoes were made and be entertained as your guide points out the private jokes painted into them, as well as the painful punishments Michelangelo painted for his enemies and the secret personal message he left for the Pope. The tour ends at St. Peter’s Basilica, where you are treated to the masterpieces inside. The world-renowned altar, Michelangelo’s ‘Pieta,’ not to mention the Basilica itself with its impressive dome.Benefit from a small, intimate group of no more than 25 people with unparalleled early access and an unforgettable experience of the Vatican Museums and Gardens.
meeting_point: At the bottom of the wide steps across the street from the entrance of the Vatican Museums. The steps are located between Caffè Vaticano and Hotel Alimandi Vaticano, on the corner of Viale Vaticano and Via Tunisi. The Tour Operator coordinators will be wearing blue polo shirts or jackets with the Tour Operator Logo for easy recognition.

title: Papal audience and skip-the-line Vatican Museums and St Peter's tour
description: Book your tour on Musement now! receive the Papal blessing and visit the Vatican Museums and St Peter's with skip-the-line access.
about:
Get a guaranteed admission at the Papal Audience in either St. Peter's Square or Nervi Hall. Experience seeing Pope Francis and listening him welcome pilgrims, impart his blessing and lead the prayers. Thanks to our secured priority admission to the event, we will pick you up in the early morning from your hotel (or the tour operator office) and transport you to the Vatican City. Live an intense spiritual moment side-by-side with people from around the world. Feel free to pray or simply observe one of the most incredible, long-standing traditions in the Catholic world.Your experience includes a short panoramic tour of via Nazionale, Piazza Venezia, Corso Vittorio, Corso Rinascimento and the Lungotevere, with drop-off at Piazza dei Tribunali (located about 1 mile/1,6 km from St. Peter’s Basilica). Walk past Castel Sant’Angelo and via della Conciliazione to reach the Basilica.You will check in with our guaranteed tickets at the square, passing through a metal detector. Our experienced and professional guide will take you to a spot where you will have an excellent view of the ceremony.After the audience you will be accompanied to a typical Roman restaurant nearby to enjoy a meal before returning to the Vatican, where you will finally discover the masterpieces of Christian Rome, like the world-famous Sistine Chapel and St Peter's Basilica.You won't have to worry about waiting in long lines on this tour. We are here to ensure that you skip the lines and our expert guide will be there to give you an insider's point of view. The afternoon tour is the best option to visit the Vatican Museums and St. Peter's Church without the morning crowd.The Vatican Museums
No trip to Rome is complete without a visit to the Vatican Museums. Home to 54 different galleries including four statue museums: Museo Pio-Clementino, Museo Chiaramonti, Museo Gregoriano Etrusco and the Museo Gregoriano Egiziano. These museums are home to some of the most famous works of art in the world, with artists including: Leonardo Da Vinci, Michelangelo, Carvaggio, Raphael and Giotto, to name a few. An experience that is sure to inspire the art lover in anyone. The Sistine Chapel
The 54th gallery of the Vatican Museums is the famed Sistine Chapel. Completed around 1483, the Sistine Chapel is arguably the most famous chapel in the world due to the artwork located within. View many of the most famous frescoes in the world, including the famous ceiling and "The Last Judgement" painted by Michelangelo. Not only does the Sistine Chapel hold some of the world's most precious works of art, but it is still used for religious purposes such as the Papal Conclave, that is the process through which a new Pope is chosen.St. Peter's Basilica
A popular pilgrimage site, St. Peter's Basilica is also one of the largest in the world and a shining example of Renaissance architecture. You won't regret taking this tour!

title: Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel: Tickets and Private Tour with Wheelchair Access
description: Get all the best information for your Vatican Tour with Wheelchair Access. Book your tickets, skipping the line, at official rates. Get informed, plan and book your tour in Rome, Italy.
about: This Vatican Tour is designed for wheelchair users. Your tour will be a interesting knowledgeable journey that will only last three hours and includes the Pinacoteca, Chiaramonti Museum and the Sistine Chapel. Your tour unfortunately does not include St. Peter's Basilica, but we highly recommend that you stop here before you leave Rome! We do require that you are acompanied by someone during your tour, in case you need assistance.Your expert professional guide will lead you to the most important parts of the Vatican Museums, which have wheelchair accessibility. Your expert guide will enlighten you about all the interesting facts and art pieces in the Pinacoteca. Here at the Pinacoteca you will be able to see a number of masterpieces from the greatest artists in the history of Italian painting. You will have the chance to see works from Giotto to Beato Angelico, from Melozzo da Forlì to Perugino and Raphael, from Leonardo to Tiziano, Veronese, Caravaggio and Crespi.Another museum that you will see is the Chiaramonti Museum. Pius VII Chiaramonti founded this museum and included a collection of Roman busts and statues. There are about a thousand sculptures, including portraits of emperors and gods, several fragments, friezes and relieves of sarcophagi.Your tour will then come to an end by visiting the most famous chapel in the world, the Sistine Chapel. Named after his commissioner, Sixtus IV della Rovere (1471-1484), who decided to have a large room built where the “Cappella Magna” once stood. Today, this famous chapel is visited by millions of tourists coming from around the world. It is one of the most impressive spaces with masterpieces created by the masters Michelangelo, Perugino, Botticelli and many more artists of 1400.ATTENTION: Please note that the tour price include the admission fee for Vatican Museums only for the disabled and the first helper. In case there is the second helper need to pay the entrance fees 23 euro per person. Please note that you must present your disability travel card from your home country and that the agency do not offer rental service of wheelchair and assistance services. After you have done the booking, please contact us to confirm the number of disable people in your group.
meeting_point: Via Vespasiano 46B, 00192, Rome.

title: Vatican highlights tour: Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel tickets
description: See the most iconic masterpieces of the Vatican Museums and the Sistine Chapel. Get special skip-the-line access and dive into the galleries with our expert tour guides.
about:
This Vatican highlights tour is designed to show you the very best of the Vatican Museums and give you a deep appreciation for the art, power, and politics of the Vatican City — in just 2.5 hours.You start by skipping the (always long) lines to get into the museums, diving right into the galleries holding some of the most famous works of art in the world. Your expert tour guide will offer eye-opening insight and context (along with some great stories) as you explore the Raphael Rooms, the Belvedere Courtyard with ‘Apollo Belvedere’ and ‘Laocoön and Sons’, the Pinecone Courtyard, the Gallery of the Candelabra, the Gallery of the Maps, and the Gallery of the Tapestries.Then head to the Sistine Chapel just before closing time. Before entering, your guide will explain the stories behind the creation of these iconic frescoes as well as what they mean. Spend about 20 minutes admiring the chapel independently, after which time your guide will lead you through a special door out of the chapel and directly into St. Peter’s Basilica for an independent visit.We’re passionate about the Vatican and want to share that passion with you in intimate groups led by the most engaging, and knowledgeable guides in the Vatican. This is why we’ll never put you with a group of more than 20.Sites visited
- Sistine Chapel
- Raphael Rooms
- Blevedere Courtyard with Apollo Belvedere & Laocoön & His Sons
- Pinecone Courtyard
- Gallery of the Candelabra
- Gallery of the Maps
- Gallery of the Tapestries
- St. Peter’s Basilica
meeting_point: - Meeting Point - At the green bar (called l'Ottagono) in Piazza del Risorgimento.We meet just outside the green bar in the middle of Piazza del Risorgimento Square. This is the only bar/cafè located on the square. The bar is on the side of the square towards via Crescenzio - close to Tram stop number 19. The closest Metro/Underground stop is Ottaviano.

Gape at the Sistine Chapel, Michelangelo's world-famous masterpiece - 20 minutes before closing time

Led by an expert guide you'll get the context that makes works so much more interesting

title: Vatican Museums entrance tickets with exclusive VIP No Wait Access
description: Book your Vatican Museums VIP No Wait Access tickets on Musement now! Skip the lines, see the museums on your own and don't waste time in the summer heat.
about: If you'd rather visit the Vatican Museums on your own without a guided tour, but still want to skip the long line outside (wasting hours of time in the summer heat!), don't forget to take advantage of our No Wait Vatican entrance tickets with "No Wait Access" service.How do "No Wait" Vatican tickets work?It's easy. After you book your tickets, you will be provided with a voucher. This voucher is not an actual ticket so you will not be able to enter the Vatican Museums with it alone. Instead, you will meet a company representative across the street from the Vatican Museums, and they will escort you inside, allowing you to skip the line, and exchange the voucher for a ticket. Once you're past security, our representative will provide you with a City Wonders map to help you find your way around the Museum and navigate the works of the Sistine Chapel.It's as simple as that, you are now free to explore the Vatican Museums on your own!
meeting_point: At the bottom of the wide steps across the street from the entrance of the Vatican Museums. The steps are located between Caffè Vaticano and Hotel Alimandi Vaticano, on the corner of Viale Vaticano and Via Tunisi. Meeting point starting from May 1, 2018: Near the corner of Piazza Santa Maria delle Grazie and Via Candia, at the very bottom of the steps that join Via Candia to Viale Vaticano
highlights: With our No Wait Access you'll bypass long lines snaking into both the Vatican Museums and St Peter's Basilica
This is an easy way to explore the Vatican Museums at your own pace
We reserve and hand the tickets directly to you, you don't need to call, re-confirm or worry about where to pick them up
Tickets sell out fast and far in advance – book now to avoid disappointment

title: 24 or 48-hour hop-on hop-off bus + Colosseum tickets with optional Vatican Museums
description: Book your Rome hop-on hop off bus ticket with Musement and save time to visit the Colosseum and Vatican Museums. Add a convenient 48-hour public transport pass.
about: Get on the City Sightseeing Open Bus at one of the many stops and explore the city at your own pace. Get on and get off anywhere and anytime you please.TOURIST BUS + COLOSSEUMGet your VIP entrance to visit the Colosseum. This ticket also includes the entrance to the Roman Forum and the Palatine Hill.Visit the Colosseum, the most important and famous of all roman monuments, where thousands of men and wild animals were put to death before a blood-thirsty audience. Explore the Ancient city, the Roman Forum, see the very sight where the body of Julius Caesar was cremated, the Arch of Titus, the Temple of the Vestal Virgins, the Senate House, the ancient market, the brothels and walk on the Via Sacra, where legions used to march during triumphal parades. Visit the Palatine hill, the core of the Seven Hills, one of the most ancient parts of the city.TOURIST BUS + COLOSSEUM + VATICAN MUSEUMSThis combo ticket includes skip the lines access to the Colosseum, Roman Forum, Palatine Hill and Vatican Museums.Visit all the highlights of the Vatican Museums, from the Sistine Chapel to lesser-known gems of the collection. You will see the Hall of Maps, the Pinecone Courtyard, the Gallery of Tapestries, the Gallery of Candelabra and the incredible Raphael Rooms. A definite highlight of your visit comes when you visit the Sistine Chapel. Take some time inside this world-famous room to pick out the details you heard about – Michelangelo’s boneless self-portrait for example, in which he expresses to the world that he would rather be skinned alive than paint the Sistine Chapel again.
meeting_point: You can change your Voucher directly on board of the open bus or you can at our City Sightseeing Rome Visitor Center situated in Via IV Novembre 147. The Admission to the Colosseum is valid only on the date shown on the voucher. The Skip the line ticket can only be used on the first day, not the 2nd day. It is reccomended to redeem the voucher at the City Sightseeing Rome Visitor Center located in Via IV Novembre 147 before 1.00 pm.

title: Skip-the-line afternoon tour of the Vatican Museums and St Peter's Basilica
description: Book your skip-the-line afternoon tour of the Vatican Museums on Musement today! See the great masterpieces, the Sistine Chapel and St Peter's Basilica.
about:
Discover the masterpieces of Rome on this tour of the Vatican Museums, Sistine Chapel and St. Peter's Basilica. You won't have to worry about waiting in long lines on this tour! We are here to ensure that you skip the lines and our expert guides will be there to give you an insider's point of view. The afternoon tour is the best option to visit the Museums and St. Peter's Basilica without the morning crowd!Vatican Museums
No trip to Rome is complete without a visit to the Vatican Museums. Home to 54 different galleries including four statue museums: Museo Pio-Clementino, Museo Chiaramonti, Museo Gregoriano Etrusco and the Museo Gregoriano Egiziano. These museums are home to some of the most famous works of art in the world, with artists including: Leonardo Da Vinci, Michelangelo, Carvaggio, Raphael and Giotto, to name a few. An experience that is sure to inspire the art lover in anyone.Sistine Chapel
The 54th gallery of the Vatican Museums is the world-known Sistine Chapel. Completed around 1483, The Sistine Chapel is arguably the most famous chapel in the world due to the artwork located within. View many of the most famous frescoes in the world, including the famous ceiling and "The Last Judgement" painted by Michelangelo. Not only does the Sistine Chapel hold some of the world's most precious works of art, it is still used for religious purposes such as the Papal conclave - the process through which a new Pope is chosen.St Peter's Basilica
A popular pilgrimage site, St. Peter's Basilica is also one of the largest in the world and a shining example of Renaissance architecture. Hotel transportation service is available for an extra cost and is on a per person basis: check if your hotel is listed in the hotel pick-up list before selecting this price.
meeting_point:
- Meet up time is between 02.15-02.30pm in Piazza del Risorgimento (at the center of the square you will find our staff members at the “Bar - Caffetteria L’Ottagono”, 400 metres from the nearest metro stop "Ottaviano")
- The pick-up service is available from a wide selection of hotels in Rome: if you selected the option with pick-up, please contact Gray Line - I Love Rome at least 24 hours before the tour to confirm the service availability. If your hotel or accomodation is not reached or without a confirmation of pick-up, the tour will be considered starting from the departure point (Piazza del Risorgimento), with meeting time 20 minutes before the tour starts.
highlights: Get straight inside the wonderful galleries of the Vatican Museums and the Sistine Chapel
An exclusive No Wait access to see the most famous art collection in the world

title: Guided tour of the Vatican Museums and Gardens with access to Bramante Staircase
description: Buy your tickets for visiting the Vatican Museums and Gardens. Your guided tour will also include the restricted area of the Bramante Staircase.
about: Make the most of your tour of the Vatican Museums with a special visit to the Bramante Staircase, whose access is only possible to those willing to spend huge sums of money. Visit the Bramante Staircase and the Vatican Gardens, places usually closed to visitors, in a group of no more than 25 people.No trip to Rome is complete without a visit to the Vatican Museums. Made up of fifty-four different galleries, these museums are home to some of the most famous works of art in the world, with artists including Leonardo Da Vinci, Michelangelo, Caravaggio, Raphael and Giotto, to name a few.Our exclusivity is the inclusion of the 1505 Bramante Staircase, a section of the Museums now closed to the general public. Thanks to our partnership with the Vatican we are able to let our customers enjoy this fascinating structure for free, designed to allow people and animals to go up and down without interruption, but, above all, to permit Pope Julius II to enter his private rooms without getting off his carriage. In this corner of the Museums, you'll live special moments of ecstasy admiring quaint views and listening to your guide as they tell you about this unique architecture which inspired numerous copycats.
meeting_point: Please make your way to the departure point 20 minutes prior to the tour start time: Caffé Vaticano located in Viale Vaticano 100, opposite from the Vatican Museums entrance. Late arrivals won’t be accommodated.

title: Skip-the-line tickets to the Vatican Museums  and Sisitine Chapel by train from Florence
description: Jump from Florence to discover Roma by hop-on/hop off and join our Vatican museums and Sistine Chapel skip the line tour
about: With the help of our greeter (who will give you all the instructions), board your high-speed train to reach Rome (approx: 1.5 hours). Once arrived in Rome, you can see the highlights of Rome at your own pace as you move into the city to reach the meeting point. You’ll have a hop-on/hop-off all-day pass to get on a comfortable double-decker bus: at Rome Termini Station, go to the closest “hop on - hop off” stop to reach the Vatican tour meeting point (buses depart every 15 min approximately). Thanks to our special Skip-the-Line access, you’ll see all the wonders of the Vatican City, including the Sistine Chapel and St. Peter’s Basilica. Reaching the Vatican Museums, the guide will give you an overview of the history and art of the smallest state in the world. The most famous frescoes in the world will greet you when you enter the jewel box of the Sistine Chapel. Last, but not least, you’ll see the grand cathedral sits atop the very spot where St. Peter was buried. On this self-guided part of the tour, you’ll see the church’s chapels and elaborately painted, multi-domed ceiling; also, Michelangelo’s remarkable Pietà. At the end, hop again on the bus to get back to Termini Station, board your high-speed train and relax while reaching Florence.
meeting_point: Santa Maria Novella Station, in front of Venchi chocolate shop. It is just inside the main entrance on the left facing the station.

title: Private Rome full-day shore excursion from the Port of Civitavecchia
description: See the best of Rome with private transportation, and skip-the-lines at the most popular attractions with an expert guide with your tickets from Musement.
about:
See the best of Rome in one day with private transportation, and skip-the-lines at the most popular attractions with a dedicated expert guide. Immerse yourself in Roman history as you journey through beautiful museums and ancient ruins. Tour Rome's most significant monuments, the famous piazzas, Colosseum and the Vatican Museums.
The tour will start from the Port of Civitavecchia with an easy and comfortable drive to Rome that will take approximately 1 hour and 10 minutes. During this time your private driver will point out various points of interest along the way and answer any questions that you may have about your day.Then you’ll be taken to the heart of the city, to see its absolute wonders like the Colosseum and the Pantheon. At noon you’ll have a traditional Roman lunch. Afterwards move to the Spanish steps, and see both the Navona Square and the Trevi’s Fountain.
The day trip includes a dedicated personal tour guide to show you all of Rome's highlights and the Vatican museums, as well as ensuring you make it back to the cruise ship at the end of the day.

title: Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel night tour
description: Book your Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel night tour on Musement now! Avoid all crowds and the summer heat and enjoy a true treat.
about: The Vatican Museums opens at night after official hours for limited dates each year. These dates must be booked in advance and have limited availability. If you manage to snag a spot on our Vatican Museums Night Tour, you are in for a true treat.If you have ever visited the Vatican Museums on a summer morning, stepping into its luxurious halls at night can be quite the opposite experience. Long gone are the stressful crowds and overheated rooms typical of daytime visits. In its place, a relaxing tour of all of the highlights the museum has to offer! You’ll enter the museum via our pre-booked, no-line entrance with an expert English-speaking guide who will play an instrumental role in making your visit an unforgettable one.As you explore the Vatican Museums you’ll visit many of the same highlights visited on our daytime tours. You’ll see the intricate artistry of master weavers in the Gallery of the Tapestries and the stunning painted ceilings of the Candelabra Gallery. See what cities and countries you can spot in the Hall of the Maps and experience the Museum’s most prized sculpture in the Octagonal Courtyard. We’ll take our time as we explore Raphael's Rooms, which show the master at the height of his powers. Your charismatic guide will enrich your visit with the history and stories behind the art and artists. In intimate groups of just 20 people, you’ll have plenty of interaction with your guide who will be happy to answer any questions you might have.Finally, you’ll experience the Vatican Museum’s highlight, the Sistine Chapel, in the unique atmosphere of the evening. Few have the chance to stand beneath Michelangelo’s most important creation at this hour! With fewer visitors around, you’ll be able to better appreciate the incredible effort that went into this ceiling.
meeting_point: At the bottom of the wide steps across the street from the entrance of the Vatican Museums. The steps are located between Caffè Vaticano and Hotel Alimandi Vaticano, on the corner of Viale Vaticano and Via Tunisi.

title: Combo tour: Vatican museums, Sistine chapel, Colosseum, Forums and Palatine Hill
description: Purchase now this combo tour for a full immersion in Roma: visit the Colosseum, Roman Forum, Palatine Hill and Vatican Museums with the famous Sistine Chapel!
about:
Saving your time and your money, with this “Combo Tour” you will have the opportunity and the security to visit with a professional English local guide the COLOSSEUM, ROMAN FORUMS, PALATINE HILL and VATICAN MUSEUMS WITH SISTINE CHAPEL, without the stress of looking for any ticket and of waiting hours in the long lines. Step 1 Colosseum Tour: You’ll meet your guide near the entrance to The Colosseum the extraordinary amphitheater was ancient Rome’s center of public entertainment. Before you enter, your guide will give you a thorough history lesson about the site, including the gladiatorial lashes and wild-animal fights that were once staged here. Once you’re inside, you’ll wander remnants of the seating arcades that once fit more than 60,000 spectators. Next comes the Roman Forum where you’ll explore the one time cultural, economic, and
political center of ancient Rome. You’ll walk along the Via Sacra, tracing the paths of ancient military processions and political rallies. Next is Palatine Hill: where the twins Romulus and Remus first decided to begin building the city of Rome atop this impressive hill. You’ll understand why as you walk here among its ruined emperors’ palaces and still-blooming botanical gardens. Step 2 Vatican City Tour Itinerary: The Vatican Museums - Reaching the Vatican Museums, the guide will give you an overview of the history and art of the smallest country
in the World. At the entrance to the Vatican Museums and skipping right past the long entry lines you’ll walk through cavernous galleries filled with ancient sculptures, tapestries, maps, and Etruscan antiquities. The most famous frescoes in the world will greet you when you enter the jewel box of the Sistine Chapel. Here, you’ll be surrounded by the stunning Michelangelo masterpieces that have adorned a million picture postcards including the nine central panels of the chapel ceiling, each depicting a tale from Genesis. Last but not least thanks to a direct passage way from the Sistine chapel you’ll enter the grand basilica- The world’s largest church, and one of its most sacred Catholic sites sit atop the very spot where St. Peter was buried. On this self-guided part of the tour, you’ll see the church’s chapels and elaborately painted, multi-domed ceiling; also, Michelangelo’s remarkable Pietà a sculptural depiction of the Virgin Mary cradling her son.

title: Exclusive Friday night at the Vatican Museums with dinner
description: Don't miss the chance to visit the Vatican Museums at night with little crowd and taste a 3-course dinner in a wonderful location overlooking St.Peter's Dome.
about: End your day in Rome at the Vatican Museums by night with an amazing tour and an exclusive dinner in a beguiling location. Vatican City may be the smallest country on Earth, but with nine miles of invaluable artwork kept in more than 2,000 rooms visiting it can be overwhelming, especially during the day.If in Rome for a long resting weekend, or even after a busy day at work topping your hard-working week, just indulge in a tour of one of the most important museums in the world led by a professional guide on Friday nights. The tour starts with a special dinner in an exclusive location inside the Vatican City: you will have to pinch yourself when a tour assistant will take you to the so-called Giardino Quadrato for your outdoor meal overlooking St. Peter's Dome.After dinner, you will be led into the Vatican Museums, one of the most important places in the history of human civilization. Get to know the important collections of art the various popes have acquired throughout the centuries. Look out for renowned sculptures and masterpieces of Renaissance art. Feel the weight of history and get a sense of the sacred as you spy paintings by Raphael, Giotto, Leonardo da Vinci, Caravaggio and Michelangelo, including his masterwork: the Sistine Chapel.Thanks to the special agreement as Tour Operator Partners of the Vatican Museums you will skip all lines, saving long waits that usually form outside this popular attraction.

about: Enjoy a full-day tour that combines visits to the two most famous places in Rome! On this 8-hour tour you will explore the Colosseum, Palatine Hill and Roman Forum in the morning. Following a lunch you will admire the Vatican Museums, Sistine Chapel and St Peter’s Basilica with a tour guide.Beginning in the morning you will experience the Colosseum, the superior symbol of ancient Roman, Palatine Hill, the place where Rome has its origins, and the most important and beautiful archaeological area in the world at the Roman Forum.After lunch, the tour continues with a guided visit inside the Vatican Museums, one of the most important art collection in the world.The itinerary includes the Pio Clementino Hall, Laocoon and Apollo Belvedere, the Candelabra Gallery, the Tapestries Gallery, the Maps Gallery and the Sistine Chapel, to admire the breathtaking frescos by Michelangelo, one of the most famous art works of all time.From the Museum you will exit directly to St Peter’s Basilica, the most important Christian Church in the world, to marvel at, among others, Michelangelo’s masterpiece La Pietà and the impressive Baldachin Altar by Bernini.Your tour will end in St Peter’s Square, dominated by Michelangelo’s imposing Cupola and surrounded by the famous Bernini’s double Colonnade.

title: Sistine Chapel early entrance with Vatican Museums and St. Peter's Basilica tour
description: Visit the Sistine Chapel before general public, enter the Vatican Museums and enjoy a 1-hour skip-the-line guided tour into St. Peter's Basilica.
about: Enter the Sistine Chapel before it opens to the general public and enjoy Michelangelo’s masterpieces in peace, before embarking on a thorough guided tour of the Vatican Museums and St. Peter’s Basilica.There is simply no better way to see the highlights of the Vatican without the crowds that can overrun the galleries later in the day. The Sistine Chapel wasn’t meant to be seen standing shoulder to shoulder with hundreds of other people. Beat the crowds by entering 45 minutes before the Chapel opens to the public.After spending quality time with Michelangelo’s frescoes in the Chapel, your guide will lead you on a full tour of the Vatican Museums, stopping to see all the most important works. Since you have started early, you’ll stay one step ahead of the crowds in most galleries as you enjoy fantastic art like the Raphael Rooms, the Apollo Belvedere, Laocoon and Sons, and more.When you’ve covered the Museums, you’ll enter the Sistine Chapel again, much more crowded now, and pass through a special corridor that lets you skip the lines into St. Peter’s Basilica. Here, you’ll enjoy an hour-long tour of the immense Basilica, including stops at Michelangelo’s heart-wrenching Pietá and Bernini’s enormous Baldachin altar. Afterwards, you'll be free to explore the St. Peter’s for as long as you want.

description: Get a real behind the scenes tour of the stories of the Vatican in small groups of 10 or less. Follow your Vatican guide unveiling all the secrets only an insider knows.
about: See the Museums from a true Vatican insider's point of view on this special tour, covering all of the top sights of the Vatican at a relaxed pace and in the less-crowded afternoon hours.Meet your insider Vatican guide and your small group of 10 or less before entering the Vatican Museums - skipping the lines. In this no ordinary Vatican tour, your itinerary has been personally crafted to take in the stories, history, legends and even secrets behind the Museum's most precious works.See the Vatican as only a true insider can show you. What's more - by the afternoon the morning crowds will have dissapated. With your expert English-speaking Vatican guide leading the way - your tour will take full advantage of the flow of visitors in the Museums - avoiding the most crowded rooms at the most chaotic times. Towards the end of your visit, you'll even be among the last visitors to see the Sistine Chapel - with plenty of space to contemplate and admire Michelangelo's greatest masterpiece.Your insider guide will optimize your visit on the day of your tour - being sure to see the Vatican Museum's most important highlights.Your tour will visit hidden corners of the Vatican that other tours don't. Where? Well... that's a secret your insider guide will reveal to you on the day of your tour!A typical Vatican afternoon tour will cover the Vatican Museums & Sistine Chapel, including but not limited to: Pinecone Courtyard, Belvedere Courtyard, Room of the Muses, the Round Room, Greek Cross Room, Candelabra Gallery, Gallery of the Tapestries and the Gallery of the Maps. The tour will end on the steps of St. Peter's Basilica in St. Peter's Square, providing no-line access to the Basilica should you wish to continue your visit inside on your own.

description: Skip the line and visit Vatican Museums, Sistine Chapel and St Peter's Basilica with a friendly English-speaking guide and save time to enjoy Rome.
about: Join this tour and visit the magnificent Vatican Museum, Sistine Chapel and St. Peter's Basilica with an English-speaking guide. Use your special tickets to skip the line at the entrance and save precious time to enjoy the city.The Vatican Museums contain masterpieces of painting, sculpture and other works of art collected by the popes through the centuries. They include several magnificent works of art, such as the Sistine Chapel, the Raphael Rooms and Loggia, and the Borgia Apartment with frescoes of Pinturicchio.After the Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel, your guide will lead you to St. Peter’s Basilica, the largest religious building ever built, and one of the holiest sites in Christendom.St. Peter’s Basilica stands on the traditional site where Peter, the apostle who is considered the first Pope, was crucified and buried. Originally founded by Constantine in 324, St. Peter’s Basilica was rebuilt during 16th century by Renaissance masters including Bramante, Michelangelo and Bernini.

title: Skip-the-Line Vatican Museums Small Group Tour
description: Skip the lines to the Vatican Museums on a 3-hour small group tour in Rome and discover one of the world's great art collections
about:
Skip the lines to the Vatican Museums on a 3-hour small group tour in Rome. Discover one of the world’s great art collections, including Michelangelo’s magnificent Sistine Chapel, the Raphael Rooms, and St. Peter's Basilica, the largest church in the world.
Enjoy an exclusive, small group guided tour of the Vatican Museums, with a maximum of 12 guests per guide for a more intimate experience. Skip the long lines to access the galleries, home to one of the world’s greatest collections of art and antiquities: collected by popes over many centuries, it includes stunning works by Michelangelo, Raphael and Bernini, among many others. Inside the Sistine Chapel you'll see Michelangelo’s legendary frescoes as well as the Belvedere Apollo statue in the Octagonal Courtyard.
Discover Greek and Roman masterpieces in the Pio Clementino Museum. Wander through the Gallery of Tapestries to see Flemish tapestries by Raphael’s pupils. Marvel at works by ancient cartographers in the Gallery of Maps. Then, go inside St. Peter's Basilica to see more masterpieces by Michelangelo, Rapahel and Bernini, including Michelangelo’s “La Pietà”, beneath the dome of the world’s largest church.

title: Vatican Museums and Colosseum special Gladiators' Arena skip-the-line tickets
description: Take the chance to combine an exclusive VIP entrance at the Vatican Museums with access to the Colosseum and Arena floor in just one day!
about: If you are planning to visit the Vatican Museums and the Colosseum on your own, but would still like to skip the long lines, why not take advantage of this no wait entrance tickets service to the Vatican Museums and Colosseum with special Arena escorted entrance?So how does no wait Vatican tickets work?When you book your tickets, you’ll be provided with a voucher. This voucher doesn’t constitute a ticket and you won’t be able to enter the Vatican Museums with this voucher alone. Instead, your representative, who you’ll meet at a meeting point near the Vatican Museums, will escort you inside, helping you skip the line and exchanging your voucher for an actual ticket. Once past security, your representative will provide you with a City Wonders map to help you find your way around the Museum and navigate the works of the Sistine Chapel. And as simple as that, you are now free to explore the Vatican Museums on your own!For you access to the Colosseum, your representative will escort you inside, helping you skip the line and exchanging your voucher for an actual ticket. You’ll be able to experience the immensity of ancient Rome’s most iconic symbol at your own pace, enjoying privileged direct access to the Arena Floor through the recently opened ‘Gladiator’s Entrance’, without the lines and long security checks.Feel the glory and majesty of Rome at the height of its power as you walk on the very same stones as those who came to fight here in gladiatorial combat, treading in their footsteps out onto a partial reconstruction of the arena floor, looking up at the tiered ruins that were once filled with some 50,000-80,000 bloodthirsty spectators.You are sure to hear their echoes as your eyes are drawn upward, your body turns and your mind is boggled by the elegance and engineering prowess of what was once the largest structure of its kind in the world, all from this unique 360° view, home to the gladiatorial games, exotic staged hunts, theatrical executions and even mock sea-battles.Enjoy up-close views of the underground area where the spectacle was brought to life, and the panorama from where the Emperor’s box once stood, all special access areas that standard ticket holders don’t get to see. In addition, you’ll gain access to the second floor, tracing the Colosseum’s circumference in an effort to understand what it must have been like when the stands were packed, the crowds were roaring and a gladiator’s destiny hung on their whims.After the tour you’ll also have the option of staying inside the Colosseum to continue your exploration or follow our representative to take advantage of the skip-the-line access to the Roman Forum. You’ll also be able to hike to the top of the Palatine Hill for an exceptional bird’s-eye perspective over the Forum and Circus Maximus.
meeting_point: Vatican meeting point details: Near the corner of Piazza Santa Maria delle Grazie and Via Candia, at the very bottom of the steps that join Via Candia to Viale Vaticano. Colosseum meeting point details: At Largo Gaetana Agnesi, above the 2nd floor of the metro line B (blue line) stop "Colosseo"

Visit the Vatican Museums and iconic Colosseum at your own pace

title: Rome in one day with Colosseum and Vatican tour
description: Take a 8-hour tour discovering the wonders of Rome. Skip-the-line to the Colosseum, taste a traditional Roman lunch and end your day with a visit to the Vatican.
about: Enjoy the skip-the-line access to the Colosseum and uncover the history and the archaeological wonders of Rome. After this intensive tour, you will be transferred to the Vatican Museums and St. Peter's Basilica. Access the Colosseum with no line and be ready to enter into the legend. Learn about architecture and history of this massive amphitheater which hosted ancient Romans, Senators, Emperors and Gladiators as well as animals from all over the world. Take lunch in a Roman restaurant, thereafter be ready to visit the Vatican. No trip to Rome is complete without a visit to the Vatican Museums. Home to 54 different galleries including four statue museums: Museo Pio-Clementino, Museo Chiaramonti, Museo Gregoriano Etrusco and the Museo Gregoriano Egiziano. These museums are home to some of the most famous works of art in the world, with artists including: Leonardo Da Vinci, Michelangelo, Carvaggio, Raphael and Giotto, to name a few. An experience that is sure to inspire the art lover in anyone.The 54th gallery of the Vatican Museums is the famed Sistine Chapel. Completed around 1483, the Sistine Chapel is arguably the most famous chapel in the world due to the artwork located within. View many of the most famous frescoes in the world, including the famous ceiling and "The Last Judgement" painted by Michelangelo. Not only does the Sistine Chapel hold some of the world's most precious works of art, it is still used for religious purposes such as the Papal conclave - the process through which a new Pope is chosen. A popular pilgrimage site, St. Peter's Basilica is also one of the largest in the world and a shining example of Renaissance architecture.

title: Semi-private early access to the Vatican Museums, Sistine Chapel and St. Peter's Tour
description: Avoid the queues and enjoy the Vatican Museums, the Sistine Chapel and Saint Peter's Basilica one hour before the opening hour!
about:
The Semi-Private Vatican Tour will give you a perfect chance to fully enjoy one of the most important museums in the world, the Vatican Museums and see the Sistine Chapel with a professional tour guide in a small group of a maximum of 13 people.
With more than 1400 galleries and 6 million visitors per year, the Vatican Museums is usually extremely busy and crowded, especially during the high season when they may receive more than 30,000 visitors per day. This fantastic tour is designed for you to discover the Vatican’s beautiful art in a quieter and more focused way.
Our tour guides are accredited by the Vatican and each possesses many years of experience. They are incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about their work and they will tell you all about the fascinating history of the smallest country in the world. Let them reveal to you its secrets and the mysteries of its past.
Headsets will allow you to clearly hear your guide, even from a distance, giving you time to take pictures and have a longer look at your favorite pieces of art.
See the highlights of the museums, the amazing galleries such as the Gallery of the Candelabra, where you can admire the rich collection of Roman sculptures, the Gallery of Tapestries and the Gallery of Maps, along with many other art treasures, sculptures, paintings and beautiful architecture.
Finally, enjoy Michelangelo’s remarkable Sistine Chapel in its entirety. After the tour, we will bring you into St. Peter’s Basilica through a special entrance, reserved exclusively for official guides and their groups.
By joining our Semi-Private Vatican Tour, you will skip both lines for the Vatican Museums and Saint Peter’s Basilica, thus avoiding a waste of your valuable time.
meeting_point: This tour starts from our office. Please be aware to not miss the entrance of our office: Look out for a street sign with our red circled logo and the white words "Maya Tours" on it Our Office is located near the entrance of the Vatican Museums (approx. a 5-minute walk). If you are taking public transport, we suggest you take the Metro (A-line) and get off at "Ottaviano". Once outside the station, head south on Via Ottaviano towards St. Peter's square then turn right onto Via Germanico (second street on your right). We are on the right-hand side at number 16. The street is easy to reach by Taxi as well. If you are new in town we recommend you look up our location on google maps before as Rome's streets might seem a bit confusing in the beginning. If you have any trouble finding us for whatever reason, please don't hesitate to contact us!

Visit Saint Peter's Basilica and admire all the major masterpieces of the Italian art
Avoid the crowds and enjoy the tour before the opening hour

title: VIP Vatican tour with exclusive breakfast experience and Vatican Museums
description: Buy your VIP Vatican tour on Musement today! Exclusive breakfast experience in the Pinecone Courtyard and Vatican Museums guided visit with early access.
about: Have the Vatican to yourself on this exclusive, one of a kind early morning tour that opens closed doors for a buffet breakfast in the peaceful Pinecone Courtyard – before anyone else enters the Museums! A true exclusive privilege.While the general public waits outside, you'll feast on an Italian-American buffet of pastries, meats, cheeses, hot food and pancakes made on the spot. In the beautiful Pinecone Courtyard, you'll experience a level of tranquility rarely seen by visitors to the Vatican. This is the Vatican Palaces as they were made to be seen – without the crowds.After breakfast you'll follow your tour guide into the Vatican Museums. Only just opened to other tour groups at this stage (still closed to the public), the Museums will be quieter than they are throughout the rest of the day – and with only 17 people max per group, you'll have time and space to appreciate the art.On your guided tour, your expert, English-speaking guide will show you all the best of the Vatican collection. You'll see ancient cartography in the Gallery of the Maps, visual illusions in the Gallery of the Tapestries and marvel at the Raphael Rooms. Raphael’s frescoes are said by many to rival the beauty of the Sistine Chapel. Of course, we won’t forget that highlight, as we visit Michelangelo’s world-famous ‘Last Judgment’ and ‘The Creation of Adam’ in the Sistine Chapel.With Skip the Line Access you won't have to wait before the next leg of our Vatican adventure. Your guide will lead you through a separate entrance to St. Peter’s Basilica where they’ll give a guided tour of Michelangelo's Pieta and the incredible altar among other works in the world’s largest historic Basilica.This tour is the first time in history that the Vatican Museums has allowed members of the public to enter so early – not to mention with a buffet breakfast – and City Wonders Tours is the only tour operator to offer it. Add to this early Museums access, small group sizes and a dedicated tour guide and you have easily the most relaxing way to see the Vatican Museums.
meeting_point: At the bottom of the wide steps across the street from the entrance of the Vatican Museums. The steps are located between Caffè Vaticano and Hotel Alimandi Vaticano, on the corner of Viale Vaticano and Via Tunisi.

The Vatican hides so many treasures that it makes sense to visit it the smart way: skipping the lines at the entry and learning about its wonderful collections from a professional local guide.
Moreover, this guide is dedicated 100% to you and your (private) group, so that you can ask them all the questions and curiosities you might have.

title: Best of Rome walking day tour with skip-the-line entry at the Vatican museums
description: See the the best of Rome on a full-day walking tour with a local guide, you won't miss any of the top sights, when you book with Musement.
about: Your tour starts in the middle of it all, as your friendly guide will be waiting for you right outside the Metro Stop Colosseo. Yep, you guessed right, first stop: The magnificent Colosseum! That’s just the beginning of the journey which that you will see walking through the Forum to the Piazza Venezia and the controversial Vittorian. Making your way through the streets of Rome, you’ll emerge at the top of the Spanish Steps to one of the best views of the Eternal City. The sights only get more iconic from here; next up is the Trevi Fountain, where your guide will teach you how to throw your coin over your shoulder (or maybe two?); Piazza Navona where you’ll learn all about Bernini, Rome’s version of Michelangelo; and the Pantheon, which for many visitors is the most incredible spot in the entire city.After a short break at one of Rome’s best and oldest gelaterias, Make our way to the Castelo di Sant'Angelo. There, looming in the distance, you’ll see the mother of all churches: Saint Peter’s Basilica, the biggest church in the world within the smallest country in the world.From here the tour will end, or you can select the optional Vatican Museums tour to continue with your guide inside! Begin your tour of the Vatican Museums with a fully-licensed guide, who will teach you all the legends, history and curiosities of this enigmatic place. Best of all: you’ll skip-the-line, giving you maximum time in the museum!

title: Sistine Chapel express and Vatican Museums ticket
description: In Rome for a few days? Take advantage of the Sistine Chapel express and Vatican Museums tour and enjoy no wait access to these famous landmarks.
about: Early access to the Sistine Chapel is perfect for those who want to see this masterpiece without the crowds. By gaining access before other tour groups and the general public, you will be sure to experience it as it was meant to be. After your quiet Sistine Chapel visit you can choose to enter the Vatican Museums, wandering the Papal Palace on your own, seeing all there is to see on your own time and at your own pace. If time is short, you can fly on to the next sight on your list, content in the knowledge that you have seen Rome’s finest masterpiece.Our Early Access Sistine Chapel group meets before the Vatican Museums open, skipping the long lines already outside and entering before anyone else. Visitors will be accompanied to the Sistine Chapel where they’ll be the first to enter, finding this incredible hall empty. Later in the day there will barely be room to move, but in the minutes before opening time, all is quiet.After the Sistine Chapel, visitors can wander the Vatican Museums for the rest of the day free of charge – and with such an early meeting time, the day ahead is long. Your escort will leave you with a map and an introduction to the most important areas of the museums so you can get the most from your time with the Vatican’s nine-mile art collection.City Wonders is currently the only tour operator to offer this special access, getting visitors into the Vatican Museums at 07.45am, 15 minutes ahead of other tour operators and 1 hour and 15 minutes before the general public. With no more than 20 people per group and a maximum of two City Wonders groups running per day, your Sistine experience will be as intimate as it should be.
meeting_point: At the bottom of the wide steps across the street from the entrance of the Vatican Museums. The steps are located between Caffè Vaticano and Hotel Alimandi Vaticano, on the corner of Viale Vaticano and Via Tunisi.

title: Vatican Museums, Sistine Chapel & St. Peter's Basilica skip-the-line guided tour
description: Benefit from skip-the-line access to admire the beautiful Vatican Museums and experience the magnificence of the Sistine Chapel and St. Peter's Basilica.
about:
Benefit from skip-the-line access to some of the Vatican's top attractions on this 2,5-hour guided tour. Admire the beautiful Vatican Museums, Sistine Chapel and St. Peter's Basilica, feast your eyes on the artworks of old masters like Michelangelo and Raphael, and explore the Pio Clementine Museum, Belvedere Courtyard and more.Start your tour heading to the Vatican Museums and let your guide bring the works of art to life at the Pinecone Courtyard, the Hall of Maps, the Gallery of Tapestries, and the Gallery of Candelabra. You'll learn about the figures responsible for these works and their history along the way.
Later, visit the magnificent Sistine Chapel. Take some time inside the world-famous room to pick out the details you hear about – Michelangelo’s self-portrait, for example, in which he expresses to the world that he would rather be skinned alive than paint in the Sistine Chapel again. As incredible as his work is, it must have been back-breaking – a fact you’ll understand all the better after you learn what it takes to create a fresco.
After the Sistine Chapel, enjoy No Wait Access yet again, exiting through a special door that leads straight into St. Peter’s Basilica, where you will enjoy on your own the holiest place in Christendom. See the incredible altar and marvel at Michelangelo’s beautiful sculpture, La Pietà, before heading outside to St. Peter’s Square.

title: Skip-the-line tour to Vatican Museum and Sistine Chapel with Saint Peter's Basilica
description: See the highlights of the Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel during a 2.5-hour skip-the-line tour with your tickets from Musement.
about: Begin with the Vatican Museums, where you'll skip the line and start exploring the vast collections right away thanks to the reserved ticket that comes with this tour.The Vatican Museum was founded in the 16th century by Pope Giulio II, and since then has been enriched by a large number of masterpieces through time. It is one of the largest and most-visited museums of the world, covering about 7 km (4,35 miles) of chambers and corridors.You will be taken into the museum by a spectacular big spiral staircase. Inside you will find many masterpieces from different periods of time, from classical Greek art to Renaissance masterpieces of Michelangelo. Admire the statue of Laocoön and His Sons that is one of the most famous ancient sculptures. See Raphael's chambers that collect some of the best paintings of this famous artist - such as the Transfiguration, his last one.View the major representatives of Italian art such as Leonardo, Perugino, Beato Angelico, and many more. Enjoy a view over the Vatican Gardens. You will be guided through the history and secrets of the Catholic Church and you will hear about the rivalry between the Renaissance artists.Towards the end of this tour you will visit the beautiful Sistine Chapel to admire Michelangelo’s masterpiece: The Last Judgement.At the end of the tour your guide will escort you to have a privilege entrance for the Saint Peter Basilica. You will visit the Basilica at your leisure, without the guide. Inside you can admire some Baroque masterpieces and the breathtaking Pietà by Michelangelo. You can also enjoy a moment of reflection in the Vatican caves where many popes are buried, including Pope John Paul II.

title: Skip-the-line Vatican, Sistine Chapel Tour & Access to St. Peter's Basilica
description: Gain privileged access to the Vatican Museums, Sistine Chapel and St. Peter's Basilica with the knowledge of an expert guide!
about:
Gain privileged access to the Vatican Museums, Sistine Chapel, and Saint Peter’s Basilica in the company of an expert guide. Get the opportunity to marvel at the museums’ incredible art collection, including the world-famous, Michelangelo frescoes inside the Sistine Chapel.
Meet your expert guide outside of the Vatican Museums, and then make your way inside, avoiding the lines. Learn about the history of the artists responsible for the incredible artwork inside the museums, and the insights of the world’s smallest country that dates back to the 5th Century.
Wander through the most remarkable rooms inside the Vatican with the expert knowledge of your guide, including the Gallery of Maps and Sistine Chapel.
Without the queues or the crowds, gain access to the world’s epicenter of Catholicism, history, and art. Witness the breathtaking work of Michelangelo in the Sistine Chapel, the holy interior of St. Peter’s Basilica, the Tombs of the Popes, and Bernini’s famed baldachin, the bronzed canopy over the tomb of St. Peter himself.

title: Vatican museums including Sistine Chapel from Florence by high-speed train with hop-on hop-off bus
description: Reach Florence by High Speed train and Join a tour of Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel, moving through the city with a Hop on/Hop off bus
about: With the help of our greeter, board on your high speed train to reach Rome in 1.5 hours. Once arrived in Rome, you can see the highlights of Rome at your own pace as you move into the city to reach meeting point with a hop-on/hop-off all-day pass on a comfortable double-decker bus (Buses depart every 15 min approximately). Thanks to our special Skip-the-Line access you’ll see all the wonders of the Vatican City, including the Sistine Chapel and St. Peter’s Basilica, without waiting to enter; you’ll also get a thrilling, in-depth exploration of the iconic Colosseum and other sites of ancient Rome. On each group tour, you’ll be accompanied by an English-speaking expert in Roman art and history. Reaching the Vatican Museums, the guide will give you an overview of the history and art of the smallest state in the World. At the entrance to the Vatican Museums—and skipping right past the long entry lines—you’ll walk through cavernous galleries filled with ancient sculptures, tapestries, maps, and Etruscan antiquities. The most famous frescoes in the world will greet you when you enter the jewel box of the Sistine Chapel. Last but not least, you’ll see the grand cathedral sits atop the very spot where St. Peter was buried. On this self-guided part of the tour, you’ll see the church’s chapels and elaborately painted, multi-domed ceiling; also, Michelangelo’s remarkable Pietà. At the end, board again on your high speed train and relax while reaching Florence after your journey through the History of Rome.
meeting_point: Santa Maria Novella Station, in front of Venchi chocolate shop. It is just inside the main entrance closeby Fratelli Cuore Restaurant. Your greeter will be carrying a board with the "Meet and Greet" logo.

title: Small Group Vatican Tour to Sistine Chapel and St. Peter's Basilica
description: Have the chance to admire the Vatican Museums, the Sistine Chapel and St. Peter's Basilica without waiting at the entrance
about:
Take a comprehensive tour of the Vatican City and benefit from the expertise of an art historian guide. See stunning works of art in the papal collections by Michelangelo, Perugino, Pinturicchio, Girlandaio, Rosselli, Botticelli and Signorelli.
Get insights from your guide and learn information that isn't readily available in tour books. Learn the Vatican’s historic secrets, and feel inspired to learn even more! Travel throughout the various areas of the Vatican in a small group for a more personalized experience.
Navigate the miles of galleries at the Vatican Museums to see highlights such as the Octagonal Courtyard, Gallery of Tapestries and Gallery of Maps. Enter the Sistine Chapel and be mesmerized by the frescoes by Michelangelo. Continue into St. Peter’s Basilica, where highlights of ecclesiastical art include Michelangelo's "Pieta" and Bernini's baldachin on the High Altar.
meeting_point: This tour starts from our office. Please be aware to not miss the entrance of our office: Look out for a street sign with our red circled logo and the white words "Maya Tours" on it Our Office is located near the entrance of the Vatican Museums (approx. a 5 minute walk). If you are taking public transport, we suggest you take the Metro (A-line) and get off at "Ottaviano". Once outside the station, head south on Via Ottaviano towards St. Peter's square then turn right onto Via Germanico (second street on your right). We are on the right-hand side at number 16. The street is easy to reach by Taxi as well. If you are new in town we recommend you to look up our location on google maps before as Rome's streets might seem a bit confusing in the beginning. If you have any trouble finding us for whatever reason please don't hesitate to contact us!

title: Early morning Vatican Museums private tour with Cabinet of Masks
description: Enjoy an early morning tour of the Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel, with the Cabinet of Masks, skipping all the lines and avoiding the crowd.
about: Enjoy a 3.5-hour private visit inside the Vatican Museums with access to the restricted areas of the Cabinet of Masks. You will enter one hour before the general opening, at 8.00am, skipping the line and enjoying the Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel at their least crowded levels.Your English-speaking private guide will meet you outside the Vatican Museums entrance at 7.30am; you will enter with skip-the-line tickets at 8.00am, one hour before the general entrance. During this short waiting time, your guide will explain the Vatican history and architecture.You will have the once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to enter one of the restricted areas of the Museums, the "Cabinet of Masks", whose name originates from the main subject of the mosaics that adorn the gallery floors. These beautiful, precious mosaics once adorned a Roman Villa; later, they were hosted in the beautiful Hadrian’s Villa in Tivoli.Then, you will admire the stunning Sistine Chapel, with the amazing frescoes skillfully made by Michelangelo, representing various scenes from the Last Judgment chapter of the Bible. Entering before the general opening will mean you can appreciate this masterpiece without being rushed, benefitting from the detailed explanation of your guide. The last stop of your tour will be inside St. Peter's Basilica: you will skip the line, entering the Cathedral from a small passage from the Sistine Chapel and you will admire the beautiful marble sculpture by Michelangelo, the world-famous "Pietà".
meeting_point: Meet your guide, holding a sign with your family name, at the bottom of the stairs of the Vatican Museums
